channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 在新赛季 F1 开始之前，我为 @《经济学家》撰写了一篇关于刘易斯-汉密尔顿转会法拉利的文章，以及这对他在梅赛德斯车队的最后一年意味着什么。
item.description:
Ahead of the latest F1 season, I wrote a few words on Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari for @TheEconomist and what this means for his last year at Mercedes.https://t.co/UEw15jxG46

— A. L. Noonan (@AyElNoonan) March 4, 2024

item.title: 今天上午，自由派大法官掩盖了与多数派大法官之间的深刻分歧，同意以 9 比 0 的比分支持特朗普获胜。我在《经济学人》上对半一致裁决的分析：尽管特朗普试图阻挠其选举失利，但仍将其保留在选票上
item.description:
The liberal justices papered over profound differences with the majority to agree to a 9–0 win for Trump this morning. My @TheEconomist analysis of a semi-unanimous ruling keeping Trump on the ballot despite his attempt to thwart his electoral loss https://t.co/J5TCHJ4FBW

— Steven Mazie (@stevenmazie) March 4, 2024

item.title: 金融不稳定和暴力事件给埃塞俄比亚总理带来了巨大问题，他是非洲最有影响力--尽管颇具争议--的政治家👇。
item.description:
Financial instability and violence are causing huge problems for Ethiopia’s prime minister, one of Africa’s most influential—if controversial—politicians https://t.co/ii0eztQX74 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 5, 2024

item.title: 1868 年宪法中的一个不起眼的补丁似乎从未将唐纳德-特朗普挡在 2024 年的总统选票之外。大法官们一致投票推翻了科罗拉多州最高法院的裁决👇。
item.description:
An obscure patch of the constitution from 1868 never looked likely to keep Donald Trump off the presidential ballot in 2024. The justices voted unanimously to reverse the Colorado Supreme Court’s ruling https://t.co/bjzWgb8W16 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 5, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，流亡一直是批评家躲避暴君铁拳的一种方式。现在，专制国家正试图在国内和国外控制思想和人民。
item.description:
Exile has long been a way for critics to escape the iron fist of tyrants. Now autocracies are trying to control ideas and people abroad as well as at home https://t.co/zKt4ZWdyUr

Photo: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/YyFyJSQiUM

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 5, 2024

item.title: 作者川上美惠子（Mieko Kawakami）在为《经济学人》撰写的客座文章中指出，父亲们必须正视自己无意识中的假设，才能为女性创造一个更美好的世界。
item.description:
Fathers must confront their unconscious assumptions if they are to make the world a better place for women, argues the author Mieko Kawakami in a guest essay for The Economist https://t.co/Uh4v1LRAsR

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 5, 2024

item.title: "他们想尽了各种办法来解决如何安置所有来的人，但还是不够"。@Rosemarie_Ward告诉 "制衡"，纽约市当局正在努力应对移民潮。
item.description:
“They’ve tried every which way to figure out how to house all the people coming and it’s not enough.” @Rosemarie_Ward tells “Checks and Balance” that New York City’s authorities are struggling to deal with the influx of migrants https://t.co/QSrajTCLSy 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 近三分之二的印度人以务农为生，因此该国的农业工人可以决定选举的成败。纳伦德拉-莫迪是否应该担心最近的农民抗议活动？ 👇
item.description:
With nearly two-thirds of Indians dependent on farming for their livelihood, the country’s agricultural workers can make or break elections. Should Narendra Modi be worried about recent farmers’ protests? https://t.co/SfOltt0zZ9 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 中国近来对威士忌情有独钟。2023 年，中国进口了价值约 5.85 亿美元的威士忌，是 2018 年的三倍。现在，西方酿酒厂希望更进一步，根据中国人的口味量身定制🥃。
item.description:
China has taken to whisky of late. It imported about $585m-worth in 2023, three times as much as in 2018.

Now Western distilleries want to take this further by tailoring their flavours to Chinese palates https://t.co/jTKFbJorZX 🥃

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 对于共和党的主要总统候选人来说，信息很明确：全力以赴 👇
item.description:
For the leading Republican candidate for president, the message is clear: full steam ahead https://t.co/jZtk9767yY 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 多年来，美国的新购房者一直享受着比租房者更低的房价。但如今，买房和租房之间的选择看起来大不相同。阅读原因 👇
item.description:
For years new home-buyers in America have enjoyed lower housing payments than renters. But today the choice between buying and renting looks very different. Read why https://t.co/YTe0dqrAoB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 工会很少向企业掠夺者寻求灵感。但激进投资不再是对冲基金鲨鱼的专利。埃克森美孚和星巴克是最新趋势的受害者👇。
item.description:
Trade unions rarely look to corporate raiders for inspiration. But activist investing is no longer the preserve of hedge-fund sharks. ExxonMobil and Starbucks are victims of the latest trend https://t.co/RTobsDe4NY 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 更好地了解以色列-巴勒斯坦冲突历史的阅读清单 👇
item.description:
A reading list to better understand the history of the Israel-Palestine conflict https://t.co/ubzycBn7Gp 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 政府影响了大量的文学作品。其中有些还很不错。以下是六本你不知道的宣传书籍👇。
item.description:
Governments influence a surprising amount of literature. Some of it pretty good. Here are six books you didn’t know were propaganda https://t.co/b0ulxqhCWD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 股票投资者，尤其是美国股票投资者，正享受着黄金时代。但失望即将来临。难怪资深投资者沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）认为 "不可能 "获得超级回报👇。
item.description:
Investors in equities—especially American ones—are enjoying a golden age. But disappointment is on the horizon. No wonder Warren Buffett, a veteran investor, sees “no possibility” of super returns https://t.co/HRS1e0iuR7 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 许多成功的网络攻击从未见诸报端。这些书会让你了解更多 👇
item.description:
Many successful cyber attacks never make the news. These books will teach you more about them https://t.co/Mpjs9nHSD6 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 只是没有那么充实 👇
item.description:
It is just not that fulfilling https://t.co/L32q4hoTF5 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: "@timleunig写道："在德国，政治家们认为，在公共财政上玩弄权术不会赢得选举。"在英国并非如此。他认为，在预算中增加一个 250 字的通知可以产生更好的财政政策
item.description:
“In Germany politicians believe that playing fast and loose with public finances will not win elections,” writes @timleunig. “That is not true in Britain.”

He believes adding a 250-word notice to the budget could produce better fiscal policy https://t.co/8fpjYLSfdS

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 芬太尼的毒性非常强，据说从墨西哥运来的三卡车芬太尼可以满足美国一年的需求。然而，只有约 20% 的货车和不到 5% 的汽车在过境时经过 X 光检查👇。
item.description:
Fentanyl is so po­tent that it is commonly said that three lor­ry-­loads from Mexico could supply all of America’s demand for a year. Yet only about 20% of lorries and less than 5% of cars are X­-rayed as they cross the border https://t.co/QJx0tfzBYG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 说到在现实世界中采用生成式人工智能，各家公司都步履蹒跚。然而，即使是这些小步骤也暗示着白领工作的性质正在发生变化👇。
item.description:
When it comes to real-world adoption of generative AI, companies have trodden gingerly. Yet even these baby steps hint at the changing nature of white-collar work https://t.co/B3SJIUJgZP 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼在西伯利亚的牢房里想象出了 "未来美好的俄罗斯"，但他死后，人们对他的希望也随之破灭。反对弗拉基米尔-普京战争的俄罗斯人是如何度过这个黑暗时代的？ 🎧
item.description:
Hope for the “wonderful Russia of the future” Alexei Navalny imagined from his prison cell in Siberia is all but extinguished after his death. How are the Russians who oppose Vladimir Putin’s war enduring these dark times? https://t.co/IETMFrqa8n 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 土耳其是继美国和英国之后，剧本节目销量最大的国家。它们不仅在中东，而且在欧洲和拉丁美洲也很受欢迎 👇
item.description:
After America and Britain, Turkey is the biggest seller of scripted shows. They are popular not just in the Middle East but also in Europe and Latin America https://t.co/Lw58U7oHkS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 两本引人入胜的新回忆录探讨了多配偶制和离婚问题。作者们似乎在问同一个朴素的问题：这就是女性的进步吗？ 👇
item.description:
Two riveting new memoirs explore polyamory and divorce. The authors seem to be asking the same plaintive question: is this what progress looks like for women? https://t.co/I5iYPkRX4F 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 多发性硬化症与 Epstein-Barr 病毒之间关系的发现为多发性硬化症的治疗提供了新的选择--抗病毒药物和病毒疫苗正在试用中 👇
item.description:
The discovery of a relationship between multiple sclerosis and the Epstein-Barr virus has opened up new treatment options for MS—antiviral drugs and vaccinations against the virus are now being trialled https://t.co/akQ1LLSMR9 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 艺术为英国的经济和全球地位做出了贡献。它们仍然让世界目眩神迷。但还能持续多久？ 👇
item.description:
The arts help con­tribute to Britain’s economy—and its global standing. They still dazzle the world. But for how long? https://t.co/Tkuk96Ba8B 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 旧金山的狗比孩子还多。@arynbraun 不相信--但她告诉 "The Intelligence"，美国其他城市对狗的痴迷程度其实要高得多。
item.description:
San Francisco has more dogs than children. @arynbraun didn’t believe it—but other American cities are actually far more pup-sessed, she tells “The Intelligence” https://t.co/trwmegnc0r pic.twitter.com/l395uvGrzw

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 除了欧洲，其他地方都在向上、向高、向天空发展。在伦敦、伊斯坦布尔和莫斯科等欧洲大陆的边缘地区之外，这里是被塔楼建筑商遗忘的半岛👇。
item.description:
Everywhere is building upwards, higher, further into the sky—except Europe. Outside the continent’s fringes in London, Istanbul and Moscow, it is the peninsula that tower-builders forgot https://t.co/mJBWCvNvIr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 通过巧妙、合法地利用俄罗斯冻结的资产，乌克兰可以获得其目前急需的大量现金注入，而不会损害其为之奋斗的任何原则： 👇
item.description:
By cleverly and legally tapping into Russia’s frozen assets, Ukraine could get the large infusion of cash it desperately needs now, without undermining any of the principles for which it is fighting.

Find out how: https://t.co/hR8cLPoQvK 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰遭受的不公正是显而易见的，它急需资金，而西方政府的财政却捉襟见肘。是否有合法途径让俄罗斯冻结的资产发挥效用？ 👇
item.description:
The injustice Ukraine has suffered is manifest, its need for cash is urgent and Western governments’ finances are stretched. Is there a legal way to put Russia's frozen assets to good use? https://t.co/Np8VmkZgbH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024

item.title: 本周的 "钱话 "播客：为什么西方对俄罗斯的金融战争没有阻止对乌克兰的攻击 🎧
item.description:
On this week’s “Money Talks” podcast: why the West’s financial war on Russia hasn’t stopped the assault on Ukraine https://t.co/pHtsVV44GQ 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 4, 2024
